CONCLUSION: Violations of Art. 8;Violations of P1-1;Violations of Art. 6-1;Not necessary to examine Art. 13;Pecuniary damage - financial award;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses award - domestic and Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in the village of ORG , GPE , GPE .

CARDINAL . The facts of the case as submitted by the parties are summarised in section A below ( paragraphs CARDINAL - CARDINAL ) . A description of the documents submitted by the parties is contained in section B below ( paragraphs DATE ) .

CARDINAL . The applicant is a co - owner of real estate in the village of ORG . The other co - owner is the applicant 's brother , Mr PERSON , who is not a party to the proceedings before the ORG . In reply to the ORG 's specific query in that respect , the applicant 's representative stated in a letter of DATE that the applicant 's brother did not intend to participate in the proceedings before the ORG , that the applicant had participated in the domestic proceedings by himself ( see below ) and that in any event the applicant had furnished the ORG with a general power of attorney granted to him by his brother . The document in question confirms the applicant 's right to represent his brother before the ORG if necessary .

CARDINAL . Prior to the events described below , the applicant and his brother registered a limited liability company called ORG ( общество с ограниченной ответственностью « Недра » ) and , together with their families ( hereafter “ the applicant 's family ” ) , ran a bakery business . According to the applicant , this business was their main source of income .

CARDINAL . The estate ( hereafter “ the applicant 's estate ” ) comprises a plot of land of QUANTITY transferred to the Nedra company under an indefinite lease , a house of QUANTITY owned by the applicant , a house of QUANTITY owned by his brother and industrial buildings and equipment , including a mill , a bakery and storage facilities with a total surface of QUANTITY assigned to ORG .

CARDINAL . In DATE , as alleged by the Government , or in DATE , as alleged by the applicant , he and his family left their estate as they were constantly threatened by NORP rebel fighters , who then moved in .

CARDINAL . At DATE the fighters left and the applicant and his family returned to their estate . According to the applicant , they found quarters that had been built by the fighters on the plot of land using the applicant 's building materials , but the houses , industrial premises and equipment had remained intact and they restarted their business .
CARDINAL . In DATE ORG launched a counter - terrorist operation in GPE . Fearing possible attacks , the applicant and his relatives left the village .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG consolidated police units of ORG ( PERSON сводный отряд милиции ORG РФ – “ the police units ” ) moved onto the applicant 's estate .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant and his family tried to return , but the police units denied them access to the estate .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested ORG of the Interior ( временный ORG Надтеречного района – “ the NORP ” ) to vacate his houses and industrial LOC .

CARDINAL . By a letter of DATE the ORG refused the applicant 's request . The letter stated that they would only vacate the buildings after the termination of the hostilities in the region and the withdrawal of the NORP troops . As to the alleged damage to the applicant 's property , the letter advised him to lodge a compensation claim with a court .
CARDINAL . Since , at the material time , the courts on the territory of GPE were inoperative , the applicant only submitted his claims in DATE .

CARDINAL . The applicant and his family spent DATE in a refugee tent camp in the village of GPE , GPE . According to him , poor living conditions in the camp resulted in the death of his nephew , who was DATE and DATE . The applicant submitted medical death certificate no . CARDINAL issued in respect of his nephew on DATE . It states that the boy died of acute double bronchial pneumonia . The date and place of death are recorded as DATE , NORP refugee camp . The applicant also claimed that the health of other family members had seriously deteriorated .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE respectively , the head of the local council of the village of ORG ( глава органа местного самоуправления с. PERSON ) issued CARDINAL similar certificates in respect of the applicant , his brother and their company ORG , stating that federal police units had been occupying the applicant 's estate since CARDINAL October DATE and refused to move out .

CARDINAL . On DATE , upon the applicant 's request , the military commander of LOC ( военный комендант NORP района ) ordered the police units to ensure that no damage would be caused to the applicant 's property . According to the applicant , no measures to protect his property followed .

CARDINAL . On DATE , upon the applicant 's request , a commission composed of the head of the local council of ORG , representatives of planning and building organisations ( представитель проектной организации , представитель подрядной организации ) and the military commander drew up evaluation reports ( дефектные акты ) reflecting in detail the poor state of the applicant 's property ( see paragraphs CARDINAL - CARDINAL below ) .

CARDINAL . Another commission made up of the head of the local council and several residents of ORG issued a certificate stating that federal interior troops had been stationed on the applicant 's estate from DATE until DATE , and that they had damaged the applicant 's houses and industrial premises , the damage having been certified by the above - mentioned evaluation reports . The undated certificate was signed and sealed by the commission members and the military commander .

CARDINAL . NORP In a letter of CARDINAL DATE an acting prosecutor of LOC ( исполняющий обязанности прокурора NORP района ) suggested that the military commander should order the police units either to vacate the applicant 's house or enter into a lease agreement with him . The commander never responded .
CARDINAL . By a letter of DATE an acting prosecutor of LOC invited the applicant to apply to a court in the event of the police units ' refusal to follow the above recommendation .

CARDINAL . From DATE the applicant also lodged a large number of complaints with ORG bodies , including military authorities , prosecutors at various levels and other law - enforcement agencies , regional and federal administrative authorities , seeking eviction of the police units . Mostly he received formal responses by which his complaints were transmitted to other bodies , but no effective measures were taken .

CARDINAL . In DATE the courts in GPE became operational again . The applicant , in his own name and on behalf of his brother , brought an action in which he sought the eviction of the GPE consolidated police units from his estate .

CARDINAL . By a default judgment of DATE ORG of GPE confirmed the title of the applicant and his brother to the plot of land and the houses and industrial premises , with reference to numerous documents submitted by the applicant . The court , having examined the evidence submitted by the applicant , found as follows :

“ ... Internal troops and police units from various regions of GPE involved in the counter - terrorist operation in GPE occupied the houses and industrial premises belonging to the GPE , without seeking approval of the rightful owners and in breach of all the provisions of law in force and LAW . The power structures , called upon to protect the interests of civilians , have themselves turned to breaching LAW ...

The well - foundedness of [ the applicant 's ] claim can also be confirmed by the district prosecutor 's letter addressed to the district military commander , which states that since DATE the police units of the federal troops have been occupying the residential and industrial premises belonging to [ the applicant ] on the western outskirts of the village of ORG in LOC . The actions of the police units of the federal forces have flagrantly breached [ the applicant 's ] housing and civil rights secured by LAW and by housing and civil legislation .
Earlier , on DATE , the military commander of LOC issued an order obliging the defendant to preserve the GPE ' property and upon the expiry of a DATE period to return them their property intact .
The defendant ignored this order . ”
The court concluded that the GPE police units of ORG had adversely occupied the applicant 's estate and ordered their eviction , thus allowing the applicant 's claim in full .

CARDINAL . On DATE the judgment came into force and enforcement proceedings were commenced accordingly . A bailiff 's attempts to enforce the judgment proved to have been in vain , as the police units refused to comply with the writ of execution . In his attempts to enforce the judgment the bailiff unsuccessfully sought the assistance of the head of the administration of LOC , the military commander of LOC and the military commander of GPE .
CARDINAL . The applicant 's numerous complaints to local and federal administrative bodies were to no avail .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE forwarded the applicant 's request to enforce the judgment in his favour to the NORP Minister of Justice and invited him to take the necessary measures .

CARDINAL . According to the Government , in DATE , within the statutory time - limit provided for in domestic law for the enforcement of a final judgment , the GPE police units vacated the buildings on the applicant 's estate , but relocated to the applicant 's plot of land instead .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Special Envoy of the NORP President for Rights and Freedoms in GPE ( ORG представитель ORG по соблюдению прав и свобод человека PERSON ) requested the NORP Minister of the ORG to order the enforcement of the judgment of DATE . On DATE the Special Envoy sent the applicant 's new complaint to the Minister of the ORG and stated that he had still not received any reply to his previous query of CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the President of ORG for the Promotion of the PERSON of the Political , Social , and Economic Situation and ORG in GPE ( PERSON по содействию нормализации общественно-политической и социально-экономической обстановки и соблюдению прав человека PERSON ) notified the Minister of the Interior of the unlawful occupation by the police units of the applicant 's estate and their refusal to comply with the judgment in the applicant 's favour and requested that the Minister take up the applicant 's case , given that it had already attracted the attention of the Commissioner for Human Rights of ORG .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the first deputy - head of ORG GPE ( FAC – “ the President 's Office ” ) transmitted the applicant 's complaint to the Minister of the Interior for examination .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG forwarded the applicant 's complaint to the prosecutor 's office of GPE ( прокуратура Чеченской республики ) “ for examination on the merits ” .

CARDINAL . By letter of DATE the first deputy commander of ORG in LOC ( первый заместитель командующего ОГВ(с ) в СКР – “ the deputy commander ” ) informed ORG that the judgment in the applicant 's favour had been executed and the defendant units had left the applicant 's estate . In reply , on DATE a bailiff reported that the judgment remained unenforced . He stated that he had visited the applicant 's estate and found out that even though the ORG consolidated police units had left , the NORP consolidated police units ( ORG сводный отряд милиции ) had moved into the applicant 's property .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor 's office of GPE invited the Chief Bailiff of GPE ( главный судебный пристав ORG ) to provide information as to what measures had been taken to enforce the judgment in the applicant 's favour and whether the question of administrative or criminal liability for evasion from enforcement by the personnel of the consolidated police units had ever been raised . It is unclear whether any answer was given to this query .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Chief Bailiff informed ORG that the term allowed for the examination of the applicant 's complaint regarding the prolonged non - enforcement had been extended for DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG informed ORG that the judgment of DATE had been enforced .
CARDINAL . In a letter of DATE the prosecutor 's office of GPE , with reference to the letter of the deputy commander of DATE , notified the applicant that the judgment had been executed .

CARDINAL . According to the Government , on DATE the bailiff imposed a fine equal to CARDINAL times the minimum monthly salary on the police units for their refusal to comply with the court judgment . The fine , however , could not be recovered because of delays in the payment of wages to military personnel in GPE . The Government also submitted that on DATE the GPE police units had left the territory of the applicant 's estate , and the bailiff had closed the enforcement proceedings and returned the writ of execution to FAC on DATE , but thereafter the NORP police units had occupied the applicant 's estate .

CARDINAL . On DATE , in the course of the eviction proceedings , the bailiff drew up CARDINAL reports on the eviction of the police units from the applicant 's houses and industrial LOC . The reports listed items of the applicant 's property that had been destroyed or damaged and were signed by the applicant , the bailiff and CARDINAL attesting witnesses ( see paragraphs CARDINAL - CARDINAL below ) . It does not appear that the actual eviction took place .

CARDINAL . In a letter of CARDINAL DATE a Deputy Chief Bailiff of GPE informed the applicant of the developments in his case , stating that the execution of the judgment depended in fact on ORG rather than on the efforts of a bailiff .

CARDINAL . By a letter of CARDINAL DATE ORG transmitted the applicant 's new complaint to ORG . It also referred to the Chief Bailiff 's letter of DATE and stated that even though DATE had already passed , no information had been submitted on the developments in the enforcement proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiff reported that on an unspecified date the police had vacated the houses , but remained in quarters they had built on the applicant 's land and continued using the applicant 's resources for their needs . The report also stated that the NORP consolidated police units had been replaced by the PERSON consolidated police units ( сводный отряд милиции УВД GPE области ) , that trenches , check - points and barbed wire restricted access to the land , and that the applicant could not enter it even for a short time , let alone permanently reside there .

CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiff closed the enforcement proceedings , as the police units had finally left the applicant 's estate . The bailiff drew up a report on the eviction , briefly indicating the damage to the applicant 's property . It was signed by the applicant , the bailiff and CARDINAL attesting witnesses ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant , acting in his own name and on behalf of his brother , brought an action against ORG of the Interior in LOC of GPE ( PERSON межмуниципальный суд г. PERSON – “ the ORG ” ) . He complained that the consolidated police units of ORG had occupied and wrecked his estate and had been refusing to comply with the judgment of DATE . He sought recovery of possession of his movables and real property as well as compensation in an amount of MONEY ( RUB ; approximately EUR CARDINAL ) for pecuniary losses that he had sustained as a result of the adverse occupation of his estate and compensation in an amount of RUB CARDINAL ( approximately ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) for the damage caused thereto . The applicant also stated that as a result of the unauthorised occupation of his estate he and his family had had to live in a refugee camp in appalling conditions which had resulted in the death of his nephew , and he claimed compensation of RUB MONEY ( approximately EUR CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) in respect of non - pecuniary damage .

CARDINAL . The applicant filed numerous documents in support of his claims , including those confirming his and his brother 's title to the houses , industrial buildings and the plot of land , CARDINAL registration certificates in respect of the Nedra company , his applications to various ORG bodies and respective replies , a copy of the judgment of DATE and the bailiff 's reports on the police units ' failure to comply with that judgment as well as the certificate issued by the commission made up of the head of the local council of ORG and local residents ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) , together with the evaluation reports of CARDINAL DATE and estimates of repair costs for his property .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG delivered its judgment . At the trial the defendant Ministry did not contest , as such , the accuracy of the applicant 's submissions or the evidence he had presented , but denied its responsibility for the consolidated police units , stating that they had formed part of the federal troops within the territory of GPE and had been under the command of the military authorities of ORG . The court made no comment in respect of those submissions by the defendant Ministry . It examined the material before it and established that the applicant owned the property in question , that the local council had certified on DATE the unauthorised occupation of that property by federal police units , that the applicant had requested the authorities to ensure his estate be vacated and that by a judgment of DATE ORG had ordered the eviction of the GPE consolidated police units from the applicant 's LOC . The court further found as follows :

“ The plaintiffs have filed a certificate issued by [ the commission composed of ] the head of the local council and residents of ORG . The certificate states that the federal military were located on the plaintiffs ' estate from DATE until CARDINAL DATE and that they caused damage to the plaintiffs ' property .

The plaintiffs have produced evaluation reports and estimates of repair costs to corroborate their arguments concerning the property damage . The plaintiffs have also adduced a calculation of lost profit ...

Having assessed the evidence in its entirety , the court sees no reason to allow the plaintiffs ' claims , since the houses and industrial premises have already been vacated , as the [ first ] plaintiff has confirmed during the hearing . Besides , another judgment in force ordered the police units ' eviction , and enforcement proceedings were commenced .

The court can not award repair costs and compensation for property damage either , since the plaintiffs have failed to present sufficient proof that their houses and the industrial premises were damaged through the fault of ORG .

The only evidence the plaintiffs have produced to corroborate their claims is the certificate issued by the head of the local council of ORG , which states that the federal interior troops caused the property damage . However , the court can not consider this document as evidence , since the date of its issue is missing . Besides , there is nothing in this document to suggest that the real amount of the damage corresponds to that indicated by the plaintiffs .

The plaintiffs have adduced photographs of their houses and industrial LOC . The court can not admit these photographs in evidence , since there is no indication that they represent the plaintiffs ' houses and industrial LOC .
In view of the fact that during the trial the plaintiffs ' arguments that it was ORG which adversely occupied their property have proved groundless , the court finds the ORG ' claims unfounded . ”

CARDINAL . The court rejected the applicant 's claims accordingly , without separately addressing his claims regarding compensation for the adverse occupation of his estate or that in respect of non - pecuniary damage .

CARDINAL . The applicant appealed against the above - mentioned judgment . He pointed out , among other things , that ORG finding to the effect that “ during the trial the plaintiffs ' arguments that ORG unlawfully occupied their property had proved groundless ” was arbitrary and contravened LAW which stated that the facts established by a court judgment that had entered into force should not have to be proved again during examination of other civil disputes between the same parties . The applicant also claimed that ORG had been arbitrary in that it had rejected the certificate drawn up by the commission consisting of the head of the local council and residents of ORG by merely referring to the fact that this certificate was undated , even though the said document directly referred to the evaluation reports of CARDINAL DATE that had been enclosed with it and submitted to the first - instance court .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's appeal . It restated , in essence , the reasoning of the first - instance judgment and confirmed that all the findings had been correct .
CARDINAL . The applicant 's subsequent requests for supervisory review were to no avail .
CARDINAL . Among a considerable number of other documents , the applicants submitted the following .

CARDINAL . Registration certificates ORG . CARDINAL and CARDINAL issued on DATE by a competent local authority in respect of the applicant 's house and that of his brother confirm that the houses belong to the applicant and his brother respectively .
CARDINAL . A temporary registration certificate of CARDINAL DATE issued by a competent authority confirms the transfer of the plot of land of QUANTITY to the Nedra company under an indefinite lease .

CARDINAL . Certified technical descriptions issued to the applicant and his brother for their respective houses and to the Nedra company in respect of the industrial premises indicate the surface area of the buildings ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) and contain a plan of the buildings showing their dimensions .

CARDINAL . The Charter of the Nedra company was approved by its founders on DATE and registered with ORG on DATE under number CARDINAL . It states that the multifunctional firm ORG is a limited liability company and a legal entity . The founders of the company are the applicant and his brother . The LAW stipulates that the founders are the company 's owners and that in case of their death the right of ownership shall be transferred to their heirs . The liability of the founders for the company 's debts is limited to the amount of their shares . They are empowered to appoint the director of the company .

CARDINAL . Certificate no . CARDINAL issued by ORG on DATE confirms the registration of the Nedra company on DATE . The certificate states that ORG is a private company , indicates the company 's registered address and the amount of the charter capital and states that the company 's “ director ( founder ) is Mr NORP PERSON ” , the applicant 's brother .

CARDINAL . Certificate no . CARDINAL of DATE confirms that the Nedra company was re - registered on DATE . It states that ORG is a private company , indicates the company 's registered address and the amount of the charter capital and states that the company 's “ director ( founder ) is PERSON NORP PERSON ” .

CARDINAL . Extract no . CARDINALa of DATE from ORG provides a very detailed account regarding ORG , stating , in particular , that “ the founders ( owners ) of the company are CARDINAL natural persons ” , namely the applicant and his brother .

CARDINAL . The applicants submitted CARDINAL evaluation reports issued in the presence of the applicant and his brother on CARDINAL DATE by a commission composed of the deputy head of the commission , PERSON , the head of the local council of ORG , PERSON , a representative of the planning organisation , PERSON , and a representative of the building organisation , PERSON . The reports are countersigned by the military commander of LOC , General - Major PERSON , and the head of the administration of LOC , Mr PERSON The reports are issued in respect of the applicant 's house , his brother 's house , the storage facility and the industrial equipment and state that each item of the property in question has been damaged and that its restoration requires a certain amount of work as listed below .

CARDINAL . The Government did not furnish the ORG with any documents before the admissibility decision was taken . After the case was declared admissible the ORG submitted a number of documents , including certificate no . CARDINAL of DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) , a temporary registration certificate of DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL ) , a decision of CARDINAL DATE taken by the applicant 's brother to re - register the Nedra company in accordance with the NORP legislation in force and to appoint the applicant as the company 's director , an evaluation report of CARDINAL DATE issued in respect of the storage facility ( see paragraph CARDINAL ) , certificate no . CARDINAL of DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL ) , registration certificate no . CARDINAL of DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL ) and extract no . CARDINAL of DATE from ORG which provides information identical to that contained in extract no . CARDINALa ( see paragraph DATE ) .
CARDINAL . The other documents submitted by the ORG may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . A certificate of CARDINAL DATE issued by a housing authority of LOC states that the residential properties of the village of ORG have never been included in a register for administration by the said housing authority and that the latter has no information as to whether the applicant and his brother have any housing .

DATE . A written explanation given by PERSON , the head of the local council of ORG , on DATE states that the applicant and his brother used to live in ORG but no longer reside there . According to PERSON , in DATE the applicant was assigned a plot of land of QUANTITY for construction purposes and the applicant built a storage facility and QUANTITY houses thereon . The explanation further states that in DATE the applicant 's estate was occupied by NORP rebel fighters who had built quarters on the applicant 's land and that in late CARDINAL they were replaced by federal police who remained on the estate until DATE . In Mr T. 's submission , he does not remember the exact period during which various military structures were placed on the applicant 's estate , and can not indicate the legal basis for the occupation of the estate . According to him , “ after the police units left , the situation on the estate was as it is now ; there were only slight defects in the rooms of the house , which we reported when drawing up documents ” . In his explanation Mr T. submits that he does not remember the date on which the said documents were drawn up , and that the local council of ORG does not have these documents at its disposal .

CARDINAL . Finally , the ORG submitted written statements by CARDINAL police officers who were stationed on the applicant 's estate at various times in DATE . The statements were made in the period CARDINAL . Officer PERSON submitted that the property had been kept in the same condition in which it had been taken over ; officers PERSON and PERSON . stated that nothing had been plundered from the estate , and that the condition of the property had been assessed as being good at the time of its transfer to other police units . CARDINAL . DATE LAW provides that housing shall be inviolable and that no one shall have the right to enter housing against the will of those living there , except in the cases established by a federal law or pursuant to a court decision .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL states that the right of private property shall be protected by law .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL provides that no one may be arbitrarily deprived of his or her home .

CARDINAL . Under LAW the rights and freedoms set forth in the LAW may only be limited by the federal law to the extent necessary for the protection of the fundamental principles of the constitutional system , morality , health , the rights and lawful interests of other people , or for ensuring defence of the country and security of the ORG .
CARDINAL . LAW provides that an owner has the right to recover his property from adverse possession .

CARDINAL . By virtue of LAW , an owner , when recovering property from adverse possession , has the right to claim from a person who knows , or should have known , that his possession is adverse ( the possessor in bad faith ) , the return or reimbursement of all profits which that person has , or should have , received during the entire period of the possession .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL states that an owner is entitled to seek the elimination of all violations of his property rights even if such violations do not involve deprivation of possession .

CARDINAL . Article ORG provides that damage caused to the property of an individual or of a legal entity shall be compensated for in full by the person who inflicted such damage . The latter may be released from the obligation to make compensation if he or she can prove that the damage was not inflicted through his or her own fault ; however , the law may provide for compensation in respect of damage even in the absence of fault by the person who caused it . Damage inflicted by lawful actions shall be compensated for in cases established by law .

CARDINAL . By virtue of Article CARDINAL , damage inflicted in a situation of absolute necessity , and notably for elimination of a danger threatening the tortfeasor or third parties , if the danger , in the circumstances , could not be eliminated by any other means , shall be compensated for by the tortfeasor . Having regard to the circumstances in which the damage was caused , a court may impose an obligation to compensate for such damage on a third party in whose interests the tortfeasor acted , or release from such an obligation , partially or in full , both the third party and the tortfeasor .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL stipulates that a ORG agency or a ORG official will be liable towards a citizen for damage caused by their unlawful actions or failure to act . Compensation for such damage will be awarded at the expense of the federal or regional treasury .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the Code of Civil Procedure states that each party to proceedings must prove those circumstances to which it refers in support of its submissions . A court decides what circumstances are relevant for the case and which party must prove them and proposes those circumstances for discussion even if some of them have not been referred to by any of the parties . Evidence is submitted by the parties and other persons involved in the proceedings . A court may propose that the parties or other persons involved in the proceedings submit additional evidence . If it is complicated for the parties or other persons involved in the proceedings to submit additional evidence , the court , on their request , assists them in obtaining that evidence .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL provides that the facts established by a court judgment that has entered into force will not have to be proved again during examination of other civil disputes between the same parties .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL establishes , as a general rule , that actions must be brought in the court of the defendant 's place of residence .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL stipulates the plaintiff 's right to bring a claim of compensation for damage to his or her property in the court of his or her choosing – either that of the defendant 's place of residence or that of the place where the damage has been caused .
CARDINAL . Under LAW , actions concerning the determination of rights over immovable property may only be brought in the court of the place where such property is situated .
CARDINAL . The Law on Suppression of Terrorism of DATE ( Федеральный закон от CARDINAL июля DATE г. № CARDINAL « О борьбе с терроризмом GPE ) , as in force at the relevant time provided as follows :
“ For purposes of the present ORG the following basic concepts shall be applied :
... ' suppression of terrorism ' shall refer to activities aimed at the prevention , detection , suppression and minimisation of consequences of terrorist activities ;

' counter - terrorist operation ' shall refer to special activities aimed at the prevention of terrorist acts , ensuring the security of individuals , neutralising terrorists and minimising the consequences of terrorist acts ;

' zone of a counter - terrorist operation ' shall refer to an individual terrain or water surface , means of transport , building , structure or LOC with adjacent territory where a counter - terrorist operation is conducted ; ... ”
“ CARDINAL . In the zone of a counter - terrorist operation , the persons conducting the operation shall be entitled :

( CARDINAL ) if necessary , to take measures aimed at temporary restriction or prohibition of vehicle and pedestrian traffic in the streets and on the roads , to prohibit the access of transport vehicles , including those of embassies and consulates , and that of citizens to certain territories or objects , or to remove citizens from certain territories or objects and to tow away transport vehicles ;
( CARDINAL ) to check the identity documents of private persons and officials and , where they have no identity documents , to detain them for identification ;

( CARDINAL ) to detain persons who have committed or are committing offences or other acts in defiance of the lawful demands of persons engaged in a counter - terrorist operation , including acts of unauthorised entry or attempted entry to the zone of the counter - terrorist operation , and to convey such persons to the local bodies of ORG of GPE ;

( CARDINAL ) to enter unimpeded ( penetrate ) private residential or other LOC or plots of land belonging to individuals , or the territory and LOC of an organisation regardless of to whom such organisation may belong ... while suppressing a terrorist act or pursuing persons suspected of committing such an act , when a delay may entail a real risk for human life or health ;
( CARDINAL ) to search persons , their belongings and vehicles entering or exiting the zone of a counter - terrorist operation , including with the use of technical means ;
( CARDINAL ) to use , for duty purposes , any means of communication , including special ones , belonging to a citizen or organisation regardless of to whom such organisation may belong ;

( CARDINAL ) to use , for duty purposes , transport vehicles belonging to an organisation regardless of to whom such organisation may belong , except for those of embassies , consulates or other representations of foreign GPE and international organisations , and to use , in the event of emergency , transport vehicles belonging to citizens for the purpose of preventing a terrorist act , or pursuing and detaining persons who committed such an act , or conveying persons in urgent need of medical assistance to medical institutions , and arriving at the scene of an incident .

CARDINAL . In the zone of a counter - terrorist operation , the activity of representatives of the mass - media shall be regulated by the head of the operational headquarters for a counter - terrorist operation , unless federal law provides otherwise . ”

“ On the basis of the legislation and within the limits established by it , damage may be caused to the life , health and property of terrorists , as well as to other legally - protected interests , in the course of a counter - terrorist operation . However , servicemen , experts and other persons engaged in the suppression of terrorism shall be exempted from liability for such damage , in accordance with the legislation of GPE . ”

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of the Law on Enforcement Proceedings provides that a bailiff 's order on the institution of enforcement proceedings must fix a time - limit for the defendant 's voluntary compliance with a writ of execution . The time - limit may not exceed DATE . The bailiff must also warn the defendant that coercive action will follow , should the defendant fail to comply with the time - limit .
CARDINAL . Under LAW , enforcement proceedings should be completed within DATE following receipt of the writ of enforcement by the bailiff .

CARDINAL . Decree no . CARDINAL of the NORP President “ On Measures Aimed at Increasing the Effectiveness of ORG within the Territory of the North - Caucasian Region of the NORP Federation ” of DATE ( указ PERSON от DATE № CARDINALс « О мерах по повышению эффективности контртеррористических операций на территории GPE региона Российской PERSON ) provided that ORG be formed in the NORP region from units and detachments of the NORP armed forces , those of the interior troops and departments of ORG of the ORG , departments of ORG , those of ORG and ORG . The decree also empowered the commander of ORG to take decisions that were binding for all the forces forming ORG .
